title: US press branded 'cowards' after British journalists' cutting questions to Trump and May
text:

It's time for you to be proud to be British. And, if you can bear it, pleased with the British press. 
Yesterday marked a historic political moment : Prime Minister Theresa May met President Donald Trump. Writing that was horrid. 
May met Trump at the White House. Together, they entertained a host of journalists, from US, the UK, and elsewhere. 
Everyone is praising the British journalists' gumption. Reporters, namely BBC's Laura Kuenssberg, asked the US president some cutting, tricky questions, while the Americans seemed a little apprehensive to do so. 
Obviously, US journalists have quizzed Trump well in the past, but some feel they haven't stood up to him enough in the past months. When the mic was passed to Kuenssberg, however, she didn't hold back. Laura Kuenssberg didn't mince her words (Photo: PA) Read More BBC reporter baffles viewers with weird 'magic' hands 
She went in hard, asking May and Trump what they disagreed on in their talks, and pressed the president on his views on torturing terror suspects. 
After being asked that, Donald Trump turned to May and said: "Was this your choice of a question? There goes that relationship." 
The billionaire wasn't happy at being called out in front of the millions watching. Twitter erupted after the conference. Many were suitably impressed by Kuenssberg and her fellow Brits. Trump didn't enjoy the questioning Donald Trump (Photo: Getty) Lots of renowned British journalists were also quick to sing their peers' praises. And a handful of US ones also conceived their questioning was on point. Wonder how long it takes for Trump to ban British journalists at his press conferences?
